title: Czerwonki, Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship
text:
Czerwonki () is a <a href="village">village</a> in the administrative district of <a href="Gmina%20Mr%C4%85gowo">Gmina Mrągowo</a>, within <a href="Mr%C4%85gowo%20County">Mrągowo County</a>, <a href="Warmian-Masurian%20Voivodeship">Warmian-Masurian Voivodeship</a>, in northern Poland. It lies approximately east of <a href="Mr%C4%85gowo">Mrągowo</a> and east of the regional capital <a href="Olsztyn">Olsztyn</a>.
As a result of the <a href="Treaty%20of%20Versailles">Treaty of Versailles</a> the <a href="1920%20East%20Prussian%20plebiscite">1920 East Prussian plebiscite</a> was organized on 11 July 1920 under the control of the <a href="League%20of%20nations">League of nations</a>, which resulted in 80 votes to remain in Germany and none for Poland. Thus the village remained part of Germany until 1945.
References.
<br>
